title: Wednesday's gossip: Kane, Rice, Mbappe, De Gea, Lukaku, Timber, De Jong
description: Kane keen on move from Tottenham to Bayern, Liverpool to rival Real for Mbappe, Arsenal to put in third bid for West Ham's Rice, plus more.

title: Sarah Henshaw: Man charged with murdering mother-of-two
description: Sarah Henshaw's body was discovered in a layby near Chesterfield after she was reported missing.

title: Illegal trade in AI child sex abuse images exposed
description: Paedophiles are using the technology to create and sell life-like abuse material, the BBC finds.

title: Klimt's final portrait sells for record £85.3m
description: In just 10 minutes, Lady with a Fan becomes the most valuable work of art ever sold at auction in Europe.

title: Julian Sands obituary: Free-spirited actor whose career started with a kiss
description: The actor earned a place in millions of hearts by wooing Helena Bonham Carter in A Room With A View.

title: Julian Sands: British actor's body identified after long search on mountain
description: The 65-year-old went missing in mountains north of Los Angeles after hiking during bad weather.

title: Belarus leader welcomes Wagner boss Prigozhin into exile
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, who led a Russian mutiny, arrives in Belarus and his men are offered a military base.

title: Drinks giant Diageo ends 'broken' Diddy partnership
description: The move comes after pop star Diddy accused the firm of neglecting his tequila brand because of his race.

title: Laura Nuttall was kindest human, sister tells celebration of fundraiser
description: Gracie Nuttall tells a celebration of her sister that her impact went "beyond any of our knowledge".

title: Kramatorsk: Russian missile strike hits restaurants in Ukrainian city
description: At least two people are killed and 22 injured in the strike on Kramatorsk, the governor says.

title: Millie Bright: England captain 'really confident' of World Cup fitness
description: England captain Millie Bright is "really confident" of being available for the start of the World Cup despite a knee injury

title: Watch: Touching moment chimp sees outdoors for first time
description: Vanilla, a 28-year-old chimpanzee, had never been outside of a cage or enclosure.

title: Ann Leslie: One of Britain's most formidable journalists
description: Respected foreign correspondent who became a forthright commentator and pundit.

title: Boots to close 300 UK pharmacies over the next year
description: The US-owned chain says it will "consolidate" stores in close proximity to each other.

title: Mateo Kovacic: Man City sign Croatia midfielder from Chelsea for initial £25m
description: Manchester City sign Croatia midfielder Mateo Kovacic for an initial £25m plus a possible £5m in add-ons from Chelsea.

title: Wagner's network in Africa faces uncertain future
description: What does the Russian mercenary group's failed mutiny mean for its fighters in African countries?

title: Guglielmo Vicario: Tottenham sign Italian goalkeeper from Empoli on five-year deal
description: Tottenham sign Italian goalkeeper Guglielmo Vicario from Serie A side Empoli on a five-year contract.

title: Glastonbury 2024: When is it, when do tickets go on sale, and who might headline?
description: A look at who could star at next year's festival, when it will be, and how to get tickets.

title: Frankie Dettori: Jockey to miss July Cup bid due to Royal Ascot whip ban
description: Frankie Dettori's bid to win every top-level Group One race in Britain is scuppered after a whip ban which rules him out of the July Cup.

title: Eastbourne International: Britain's Katie Boulter beaten by Petra Martic in first round
description: British number one Katie Boulter suffers a first-round loss to Croatian lucky loser Petra Martic at the Eastbourne International.

title: Eastbourne International: Coco Gauff wins to set up tie with GB's Jodie Burrage
description: Watch the best shots as Coco Gauff of the USA beats compatriot Bernarda Pera to reach the second round at Eastbourne.

title: Thames Water boss quits after sewage spills
description: Sarah Bentley steps down weeks after giving up her bonus over the company's poor performance.

title: Suspected World War Two grenade handed in to Telford police
description: Malinsgate police station, near Telford town centre, is shut and and an exclusion zone is in place.

title: Wagner revolt: How many planes and people did Russia lose?
description: What we know about the Russian equipment and troops lost during the recent uprising.

title: England vs Australia: Glenn McGrath says men's Ashes over if Pat Cummins' side win at Lord's
description: Australia legend Glenn McGrath is enjoying England's style of play but has warned the men's Ashes are over if they lose at Lord's this week.

title: Senior doctors back strike action in England
description: A 48-hour walkout by consultants will now follow five-day strike by junior doctors in England.

title: Prince William visits Belfast in campaign to end homelessness
description: The Prince of Wales's visit to East Belfast Mission is part of a UK tour for his Homewards campaign.

title: Wagner mutiny: Group fully funded by Russia, says Putin
description: The president says more than $1bn was given to the mercenary group in the past year.

title: Pompeii archaeologists discover 'pizza' painting
description: Experts say the flatbread depicted in the 2,000 year-old fresco may be a precursor to the Italian dish.

title: US health alert over malaria cases in Florida and Texas
description: Two states are seeing locally acquired cases- the first spread inside the US in 20 years.

title: Nicola Bulley's death was an accident, coroner rules
description: There is no evidence the 45-year-old had "any desire" to take her own life, a coroner concludes.

title: ECB recommends £500k Yorkshire fine over racism scandal
description: The ECB recommends Yorkshire are fined £500,000 and deducted points across all formats for their handling of the Azeem Rafiq racism scandal.

title: Apple joins opposition to encrypted message app scanning
description: WhatsApp and iMessage could be forced to scan for child abuse images under the Online Safety Bill.

title: Angela Bassett: Black Panther actress to receive honorary Oscar
description: The star's honorary award comes months after she lost out on an Oscar for the Black Panther sequel.

title: Moises Caicedo transfer news: Will Brighton player join Chelsea, Arsenal or Manchester United?
description: Brighton midfielder Moises Caicedo is the subject of a three-way transfer battle between Chelsea, Manchester United and Arsenal - so where should he end up?

title: Wilfried Zaha and rapper Stormzy are set to buy AFC Croydon
description: Crystal Palace forward Wilfried Zaha and rapper Stormzy are set to buy non-league club AFC Croydon.

title: Police hunt man filmed carving names on Colosseum
description: Italian officers are investigating the act of vandalism at the historic Roman amphitheatre.

title: Matt Hancock criticises UK's 'body bag' Covid approach
description: Ex-health secretary says pandemic planning focused too much on burying dead rather than stopping disaster.

title: Dolly Parton, Britney Spears and Taylor Swift tribute acts stage protest over Meta 'ban'
description: Britney Spears and Dolly Parton impersonators say Facebook and Instagram has banned their profiles.

title: Nurse strikes in England end as vote turnout too low
description: Ballot of members by Royal College of Nursing fails to reach 50% threshold for walkouts to continue.

title: England captain Stokes 'deeply sorry' to hear of discrimination
description: England captain Ben Stokes said he is "deeply sorry" to hear about experiences of discrimination in a report into cricket in England and Wales.

title: Glastonbury: Headlining with Elton John an 'out of body' experience
description: Stephen Sanchez was one of four surprise guests joining the music legend on stage, in his last UK show.

title: Spanish swimming pools in Catalonia told not to ban topless bathing
description: Activists are celebrating a ruling by the Spanish region to enforce an equality law on going topless.

title: New 'Borrowdale Banksy' slate sculpture spotted
description: The Lake District structures are named after the famous artist because no-one knows who made them.

title: Lewis Capaldi to take new break from touring for 'mental and physical health'
description: The singer wants to get his "mental and physical health in order" after struggling at the festival.

title: England vs Australia: Joe Root on captaincy, Ashes cricket and the future
description: Joe Root tells BBC chief cricket writer Stephan Shemilt that the best is yet to come in his England Test career.

title: Nicola Bulley had things under control, says sister
description: The mother-of-two was "very much a planner" as the "busy mum", her younger sister tells an inquest.

title: England choose Tongue in all-pace Ashes attack
description: England include Josh Tongue in an all-pace attack for the second Ashes Test against Australia.

title: Minke whale spotted leaping from water in Scarborough
description: A minke whale is seen leaping from the water off Scarborough.

title: Ukraine likely to have retaken land occupied by Russia since 2014, UK's MoD says
description: It comes as Ukraine's president says the country's counter-offensive is making advances on all fronts.

title: Major research lost after cleaner turns off fridge, lawsuit says
description: A US institute alleges it lost 25 years of work because a man wanted to stop "annoying" alarms.

title: Amanda Ilestedt: Arsenal sign Sweden centre-back from PSG
description: Arsenal have signed centre-back Amanda Ilestedt from Paris St-Germain.

title: How many ways can you fill a pothole?
description: Various methods of tackling the enduring problem of potholes are trialled on a 1km stretch of road.

title: Dorset migrant barge plans should be scrapped, council leader says
description: Weymouth Town Council's leader says there has been a lack of consultation over the Bibby Stockholm.

title: Dragons' Den: Gary Neville to join BBC show as guest Dragon for 2024 series
description: Former Manchester United and England defender Gary Neville is to join Dragons' Den as a guest Dragon for the 2024 series.

title: Cricket World Cup 2023: England start defence against New Zealand
description: England will begin their defence of the 2023 men's 50-over Cricket World Cup against New Zealand in Ahmedabad on 5 October.

title: ICC World Cup 2023: India to play Pakistan in Ahmedabad in October
description: The confirmation comes after months of speculation on whether Pakistan would travel to India.

title: Declan Rice: Manchester City make £90m offer for West Ham captain
description: Manchester City make a formal bid of £90m for West Ham captain Declan Rice.

title: Climate change: World way off target to end deforestation
description: Data shows that cutting down tropical forests increased by 10% in 2022, despite promises made at COP26.

title: King Charles plans new greenhouse for Highgrove
description: The new building at Highgrove House will be used to grow plants for the King's gardens.

title: Aston Martin rise is a 'reality check' for Alpine, says team boss Laurent Rossi
description: Alpine boss Laurent Rossi says Aston Martin's leap up the grid this year has been a "reality check" for his team.

title: Meal deals: Unhealthy options will be restricted in Wales
description: There will be limits on the sale of combinations of food with high levels of fat, sugar or salt.

title: The Ashes 2023: Who does better lunch & tea - Australia or England?
description: England players Harry Brook, Chris Woakes, Dan Lawrence and Joe Root tell us who does better lunch and tea, England or Australia.

title: AI cuts treatment time for cancer radiotherapy
description: The technology will be offered at cost price to all NHS trusts in England, following successful pilot studies.

title: Jamie Aarons: Woman sets record for scaling Scotland's Munro mountains
description: Ultra-runner Jamie Aarons climbs every Scottish mountain above 3,000 feet in just over 31 days.

title: St Mungo's: Staff at homeless charity being indefinite strike over pay
description: The charity has said that meeting workers' demands would leave it not "financially viable".

title: Trump heard on CNN tape discussing secret documents
description: CNN obtained audio from a meeting in which Donald Trump acknowledges keeping a classified document.

title: West Bank: US 'troubled' by Israeli settlement expansion plans
description: Israel has approved the construction of 5,700 new homes in the occupied West Bank.

title: Watch: Fire engulfs high-rise and sprays embers over UAE city
description: Residents are evacuated after a fire rips through a high-rise residential building in Ajman.

title: Warning more funding needed to enforce no-fault evictions ban
description: Councils say they will struggle to enforce the ban effectively without more staff.

title: Sarah Harding: Early breast cancer study in singer's memory begins
description: One of the Girls Aloud singer's final wishes was to find new ways of spotting breast cancer early.

title: Syria: New Captagon drug trade link to top officials found
description: Evidence shows members of the president's family and armed forces are involved in the Captagon trade.

title: NHS watchdog rejects Mounjaro fat loss jab for diabetes
description: There is not yet enough evidence to justify the cost on the NHS in England, says NICE.

title: Organ harvesting: Trafficked for his kidney and now forced into hiding
description: The inside story of the Nigerian market trader whose case exposed illegal organ removal in the UK.

title: The Papers: Putin defiant and 'fury' over new Lawrence suspect
description: A speech by Vladimir Putin and new criticism of the Met over the Stephen Lawrence case lead the papers.
